cethric.xge.engine.scene

Interface IScene

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IIntractable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Scene

    public interface IScene
extends IIntractable
    Created by blakerogan on 14/03/15.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean active()
      return is the scene is currently active.
      void active(boolean active)
      Set weather the scene is active (true) or not (false) is the scene is not active, mouse and key input is ignored.
      void register()
      Registers the scene so it can be rendered.
      boolean registered()
      return is the scene is registered see register and unregister
      void render()
      When called this function runs the scene update process
      void resize(int width, int height)
      This function is used to set the scenes width and height
      void unregister()
      Unregister the scene and deallocate the memory that was used in this scene.
      void update(long delta)
      When called this function updates the scene

      • Methods inherited from interface cethric.xge.engine.IIntractable

        keyPress, keyRelease, mouseMove, mousePress, mouseRelease, mouseScroll

    • Method Detail

      • render

        void render()
        When called this function runs the scene update process

      • update

        void update(long delta)
        When called this function updates the scene
        Parameters:
        delta - long; the time since the last update

      • resize

        void resize(int width,
            int height)
        This function is used to set the scenes width and height
        Parameters:
        width - int; the new width
        height - int; the new height

      • register

        void register()
        Registers the scene so it can be rendered. Allows for pre-game rendering and initialization

      • unregister

        void unregister()
        Unregister the scene and deallocate the memory that was used in this scene.

      • registered

        boolean registered()
        return is the scene is registered see register and unregister
        Returns:
        boolean;

      • active

        void active(boolean active)
        Set weather the scene is active (true) or not (false) is the scene is not active, mouse and key input is ignored.
        Parameters:
        active - boolean; set scene state

      • active

        boolean active()
        return is the scene is currently active.
        Returns:
        boolean;
